info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 9 at 2:18PM MDT until June 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.
* WHERE...This includes areas within and downstream of the Ruidoso area burn scars in the Sacramento Mountains in south central New Mexico.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are likely to impact the Ruidoso area burn scars midday Tuesday and will continue through Tuesday evening. Any additional rainfall, including rainfall from today's storms, will make the burn scar and creeks and streams across the burn scars highly vulnerable to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
